intro: Linum darmstadinum, commonly known as the Armenian flax. It is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region, characterized by its slender stems and delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Linaceae family and is known for its fibrous蒴果, which contains small, hairy seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and historical significance in fiber production, it is occasionally grown in gardens and botanical collections.
